analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the dependent origination, The Paṭṭhāna text with the Tika commentary

original: 23.6. Kusalattika, Pītittika🔽Nakusalaṁ napītisahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo pītisahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate nava.🔽Nakusalaṁ nasukhasahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo sukhasahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: kusalattika pītittika  na kusalam na pīti sahagatam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ pīti sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate nava  na kusalam na sukha sahagatam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ sukha sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate nava
translated: The Triad on the Wholesome, the Triad on Joy🔽With root cause as condition, an unwholesome thought associated with joy arises. (Abbreviated.) With root cause as condition, nine … With result as condition, three … With non-hindrance as condition, nine.🔽With root cause as condition, an unwholesome thought associated with pleasure arises. (Abbreviated.) With root cause as condition, nine … With result as condition, three … With non-hindrance as condition, nine.

original: Nakusalaṁ naupekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: na kusalam na aupekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate nava
translated: With root cause as condition, an unwholesome thought associated with equanimity arises. (Abbreviated.) With root cause as condition, nine … With result as condition, three … With non-hindrance as condition, nine.
